thread.title: I Took Myself on an Extremely Romantic Valentine's Date Because I Felt Like It
thread.title_full: I Took Myself on an Extremely Romantic Valentine's Date Because I Felt Like It

author: Cosmopolitan.com
title: I Took Myself on an Extremely Romantic Valentine's Date Because I Felt Like It
text:
The only thing worse than people who treat Valentine's Day as the single greatest holiday to befall the Hallmark calendar are the people who think it's *still* cute and clever to loathe Valentine's Day like it's a crime against humanity. Love it or loathe it, someone's always going to disagree with you.
The true way to win at Valentine's Day, therefore, is to do whatever the hell you want! And this year, for me, that meant becoming my own Valentine and treating myself to the sort of February 14 no man could ever successfully pull off. Why expect something from a bumbling idiot boy when you can just DO üëè IT üëè YOURSELF üëè , and do it better than anyone else possibly could? On February 14 I decided to lean way the fuck into the most obnoxiously tacky holiday of the year and give myself everything I've always wanted.
My dream Valentine's Day is one filled with all the clich√© traditions I'd never deign ask a man to fulfill for me. Not because I don't expect a lot from men I date, but because in this, our sexist society, it's uncouth for a woman to be too demanding or "high maintenance." For fear of coming across as silly and frivolous, I've always been scared of asking a man for a giant box of chocolates, even though that's something I secretly want. But this year, since my Valentine is myself, I asked me for all the tacky Valentine's items my trashy little heart desired.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Act 1: Lots of chocolates (and other trash)
